emlForm.title: A title for your dataset. It could for example be the title of your main paper or a project name
emlForm.license: Choose a license for data sharing
emlForm.doi: If you already have a DOI for your main paper, you can reuse it for your data. Otherwise GBIF will generate a DOI for your dataset that you can cite in your paper
emlForm.description: A short description/abstract about your dataset
emlForm.methodSteps: Describe the method steps (sampling, DNA extraction, sequencing, denoising, etc)
emlForm.contact: The main contact person for the dataset
emlForm.creator: All persons that should be accredited when citing the dataset
emlForm.keywords: A list of keywords that may help users find your dataset
emlForm.url: If you have a project website or similar that you want to display om the dataset homepage
emlForm.bibliographicReferences: Papers that have been published based on the dataset.
emlForm.studyExtent: This field represents both a specific sampling area and the sampling frequency (temporal boundaries, frequency of occurrence).
emlForm.samplingDescription: This field allows for a text-based/human readable description of the sampling procedures used in the research project. The content of this element would be similar to a description of sampling procedures found in the methods section of a journal article.
